update.description:
This pull request makes sure `SelectionObj` destroys all objects and nodes attached to it when it is terminated. If they're not destroyed, Ogre crashes if someone tries to create a new visual with the same name as the deleted one.

This is needed to enable mouse manipulation of `ApplyWrenchVisual`.
update.title: Fix finishing SelectionObj, with test

content.raw:
These are actually for the `SelectionObj` itself, it is nested pretty deep and it took me a while to get all the hierarchies right, so I left comments to help in the future.

Some comments refer only to `trans*` but apply also to `rot*` and `scale*`.
content.html:
These are actually for the SelectionObj itself, it is nested pretty deep and it took me a while to get all the hierarchies right, so I left comments to help in the future.

Some comments refer only to trans* but apply also to rot* and scale*.

content.raw: There's some comments here and the lines above that seem specific to the `ApplyWrenchVisual`
content.html: There's some comments here and the lines above that seem specific to the ApplyWrenchVisual

content.raw: ticketed issue #1621
content.html: ticketed issue #1621

content.raw:
unlike the gui tests, the visual tests are executed in a separate thread from the main rendering thread hence they have been giving weird problems.

To fix this, we would need to change ServerFixture, which would then affect many tests. It probably needs to be done in a separate pull request and have it tested.
content.html:
unlike the gui tests, the visual tests are executed in a separate thread from the main rendering thread hence they have been giving weird problems.

To fix this, we would need to change ServerFixture, which would then affect many tests. It probably needs to be done in a separate pull request and have it tested.

This pull request makes sure `SelectionObj` destroys all objects and nodes attached to it when it is terminated. If they're not destroyed, Ogre crashes if someone tries to create a new visual with the same name as the deleted one.

This is needed to enable mouse manipulation of `ApplyWrenchVisual`.

content.raw: Any ideas @iche033 ? I can post a backtrace from my mac if necessary
content.html: Any ideas @iche033 ? I can post a backtrace from my mac if necessary

content.raw: I think the error is normal on visual tests. Segfaults are bad though.
content.html: I think the error is normal on visual tests. Segfaults are bad though.

content.raw:
The test passes for me on Ubuntu, but I see the following console message several times:
~~~
[Err] [Visual.cc:2185] Unable to insert mesh[Cannot create GL vertex buffer]
~~~
Also, the test seg-faults on my mac.
content.html:
The test passes for me on Ubuntu, but I see the following console message several times:

[Err] [Visual.cc:2185] Unable to insert mesh[Cannot create GL vertex buffer]

Also, the test seg-faults on my mac.

content.raw:
I think it's because we're attaching nodes. From the Ogre documentation on [removeAndDestroyAllChildren](http://tool.oschina.net/uploads/apidocs/ogre3d/api/html/classOgre_1_1SceneNode.html#a26d09fce230659652aac947a61563c2c): "Note that all objects attached to this node will be detached but will not be destroyed."

I'll try to loop through all attached objects.
content.html:
I think it's because we're attaching nodes. From the Ogre documentation on removeAndDestroyAllChildren: "Note that all objects attached to this node will be detached but will not be destroyed."

I'll try to loop through all attached objects.

update.description:
This pull request makes sure `SelectionObj` destroys all objects and nodes attached to it when it is terminated. If they're not destroyed, Ogre crashes if someone tries to create a new visual with the same name as the deleted one.

This is needed to enable mouse manipulation of `ApplyWrenchVisual`.
update.title: Fix finishing SelectionObj, with test

content.html:
Sounds like a good idea. But I tried it in several ways and they all failed. Do you know what could work?

  if (this->GetSceneNode())
    this->GetSceneNode()->removeAndDestroyAllChildren();
  • seg faults
  if (dPtr->rotVisual && dPtr->rotVisual->GetSceneNode())
  {
        dPtr->rotVisual->GetSceneNode()->removeAndDestroyAllChildren();
  }
  (same for trans and scale)
  • fails test
  if (dPtr->rotVisual)
  {
    for (unsigned int i = 0; i < dPtr->rotVisual->GetChildCount(); ++i)
    {
      if (dPtr->rotVisual->GetChild(i) &&
          dPtr->rotVisual->GetChild(i)->GetSceneNode())
      {
        dPtr->rotVisual->GetChild(i)->GetSceneNode()->
            removeAndDestroyAllChildren();
      }
    }
  }
  (same for trans and scale)
  • fails test

content.raw: can the code in this function be replaced with `this->GetSceneNode()->removeAndDestroyAllChildren()`?
content.html: can the code in this function be replaced with this->GetSceneNode()->removeAndDestroyAllChildren()?

content.raw: excellent
content.html: excellent

content.raw: Made it virtual, which actually helps when `Fini` is called from within `Scene::RemoveVisual`. deaf4c0
content.html: Made it virtual, which actually helps when Fini is called from within Scene::RemoveVisual. deaf4c0
